result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua David Micke

defendant.name: Micke, Joshua David
defendant.address: N4070 E Lake Ln, White Lake, WI 54491

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua David Micke in court & in custody with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 3:23 pm.  State gives plea agreement, DRI Restitution to 2300.00 to CoVantage.  Atty Goetz gives statement, restitution has been paid.  Court DRI both counts for sentening or restitution.  Atty Goetz need to get proof for sentencing.

Defendant Joshua David Micke in court via video with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Joshua David Micke in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF144 and 15CF160.  Bond forfeiture notices have been sent out to all parties, including bond posters.  Statement by Atty Goetz in regards to bond forfeitures.  Court will orders bonds forfeited in both cases.

Defendant Joshua David Micke in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Joshua David Micke in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF144,15CF160, 15CF162 and 15CF172 and new complaint.  Cases were called earlier.  Counsel has talked to client.  Def will waive time limits for preliminary hearings and will not demand speedy trials.  Bonds to be set for 15CF172 and new complaint.  State moves to forfeit bond in 15CF160 and request additional $5000.00 bond to cover both.  State moves to forfeit $1000.00 in 15CF144.  Court will reserve ruling on bond forfeitures.  Atty Goetz request $1000 cash bond.  Court sets bond on new case and 15CF172.  Court will forfeit bonds pending hearing  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua David Micke in court via video with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Joshua David Micke in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 15CF160, 15CF162, 15CF172 and new complaint.  15CF144 also called.  Atty Goetz has copy of all complaints.  Waive reading of each complaints.  Counsel wishes to contact his client in regards to preliminary and speedy trial.  Court will allow counsel to contact def and will recall later

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF144, 15CF80, 15CF88, 15CM143, 14CM169, 14CM220, 15CF160 and 15CF162 @ 10:15 a.m. Atty Laufenberg makes statement, asks to withdraw from all cases he is currently on due to conflict of interest. Has advised Def. in writing. Def was aware cases were going to be called today. Public Defender's office is appointing Atty Paul Goetz. Court grants motion to withdraw on all. Court will send notice to Atty Goetz to appear in person on 9/14/15.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
